translated: Having attained leisure, I will practice the Dharma.

original: bdag myur song la der ni rab tu byung //🔽bdag gis 'dod pa'i khams 'dri skyon mthong ste; ;de bzhin gzugs khams skyon dang bcas par mthong //
analyzed: bdag myur song la der ni rab tu byung // bdag gis 'dod pa'i khams 'dri skyon mthong ste; ;de bzhin gzugs khams skyon dang bcas par mthong //
translated: I will quickly go and be ordained there.’🔽‘I see the desire realm as having faults;🔽Likewise, I see the form realm as having faults.

original: gzugs med khams kyang skyon dang bcas par mthong //
analyzed: gzugs med khams kyang skyon dang bcas par mthong //
translated: I see the formless realm as having faults.

original: bdag gis mya ngan 'das zhi skyon med mthong //
analyzed: bdag gis mya ngan 'das zhi skyon med mthong //
translated: I see nirvāṇa as peace, without faults.

original: 'dus ma byas chos yongs su btsal nas su //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas chos yongs su btsal nas su //
translated: Having sought the unconditioned Dharma,

original: mi rnams kyi ni rgya chen don bya zhing //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni rgya chen don bya zhing //
translated: They will work for the benefit of many people.

original: rga nad gzir ba'i sems can thar bar bya //
analyzed: rga nad gzir ba'i sems can thar bar bya //
translated: They will liberate beings who are tormented by old age and sickness.

original: 'gro bar rgyug pa dag ni bzlog par bya //🔽bam po bcu gnyis pa /🔽sh'a radva @225a *//🔽ti'i bu; de nas bdud brjed ngas kyi rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed la smras pa /
analyzed: 'gro bar rgyug pa dag ni bzlog par bya // bam po bcu gnyis pa / sh'a radva @225a *// ti'i bu; de nas bdud brjed ngas kyi rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed la smras pa /
translated: They will stop the running of saṃsāra.

original: gzhon nu / khyod kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu / khyod kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, at that time the king of māras, Muṣitasmṛti, said to his son, Smṛtilābha, “Young man, you should seek the qualities of the Buddha.

original: zhes de skad ces smras na /
analyzed: zhes de skad ces smras na /
translated: ” Having said that,

original: gzhon nu / kho bo ni /🔽khyod la don 'dod pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu / kho bo ni / khyod la don 'dod pa /
translated: he said to his son, “Young man,🔽I want what is good for you.

original: phan pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: phan pa 'dod pa /
translated: I want to benefit you.

original: grub pa dang / bde ba 'dod pa yin pas gzhon nu kho bos khyod la rjes su bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: grub pa dang / bde ba 'dod pa yin pas gzhon nu kho bos khyod la rjes su bstan par bya ste /
translated: I want you to be successful and happy. Therefore, young man, I will teach you.

original: gal te khyod kho bo'i rjes su 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kho bo'i rjes su 'jug na /
translated: If you follow me,

original: de khyod kyi don du 'gyur ro //🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de khyod kyi don du 'gyur ro // sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: it will be for your benefit.🔽”

original: de nas rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed kyis bdud brjed ngas la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed kyis bdud brjed ngas la smras pa /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, at that time Prince Smṛtilābha said to Māra Muṣitasmṛti,🔽“Evil one, I will not follow you.

original: kye mi / bdag la rjes su ston cig dang thos nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kye mi / bdag la rjes su ston cig dang thos nas rig par bya'o //
translated: “Oh, please teach me! I will listen and understand.”

original: de nas bdud brjed ngas kyi rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas bdud brjed ngas kyi rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the son of the king of Māras, Smṛtilābha, said to him:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: gal te khyod rang gi dam bcas pa la gnas par byos shig dang de lta na kho bos khyod la phyis rjes su bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyod rang gi dam bcas pa la gnas par byos shig dang de lta na kho bos khyod la phyis rjes su bstan par bya'o //
translated: if you will keep your promise, then I will teach you later.”

original: rgyal po'i gzhon nus smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i gzhon nus smras pa /
translated: The prince said:

original: kye mi / bdag la rjes su ston cig dang thos nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kye mi / bdag la rjes su ston cig dang thos nas rig par bya'o //
translated: “Oh, please teach me! I will listen and understand.”

original: zhes kho bos khyod la ma smras sam /
analyzed: zhes kho bos khyod la ma smras sam /
translated: “Didn’t I tell you that?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / bdud brjed ngas kyis rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed la smras pa /🔽gzhon nu / khyod kyis thos nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / bdud brjed ngas kyis rgyal po'i gzhon nu dran pa rnyed la smras pa / gzhon nu / khyod kyis thos nas rig par bya'o //
translated: When he said that, Smṛtimant said to the prince Smṛtilābha:

original: zhes de skad ces brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes de skad ces brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: “Prince, you should not say, ‘I will listen and understand.’

original: gzhon nu / khyod kyis ni /
analyzed: gzhon nu / khyod kyis ni /
translated: “Prince, you should not say,

original: mi bdag la rjes su ston cig dang bdag gis khyod kyi tshig bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: mi bdag la rjes su ston cig dang bdag gis khyod kyi tshig bzhin du bya'o //
translated: ‘Oh, please teach me! I will do as you say.’
